items.eaAreaName: Devon, Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Barle, River Exe, River Lyn, River Mole, River Bray

items.message:
Flooding is possible in the morning of Monday the 28th June.
The Exmoor area is forecast to receive heavy rainfall overnight from Sunday into Monday. This is expected to cause the river levels in the area to rise.
Flooding is expected between 5:30am and 12:00pm on Monday. We expect flooding to affect  Lynton and Lynmouth, Challacombe, Meethe, South Molton, Dulverton, Brushford, Winsford, Exton, Exford . 
Flooding of low lying land in the floodplain and roads close to the river is expected.
River levels are expected to remain higher than normal throughout Monday. Please take care near the areas of concern and monitor your local weather conditions.
We are constantly monitoring river levels and have staff in the area checking for and clearing blockages in this location.  We will update this message when the situation changes.

items.eaAreaName: Devon, Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Teign, River Bovey, River Lemon, River Kenn

items.message:
Flooding is possible in the morning of Monday the 28th June.
Heavy rainfall on southern Dartmoor over the last 12 hours has caused river levels to rise. 
Flooding is expected between 2:45am and 5:45am on Monday. We expect flooding to affect low lying land in the floodplain and roads close to the river in the following areas Newton Abbot, Kingsteignton, Teignmouth, Shaldon, Bovey Tracey, Kingskerswell,  Dawlish and Dawlish Warren .
Further showery rain is forecast through until Tuesday. River levels are expected to remain higher than normal throughout this period. Please take care near the areas of concern and monitor your local weather conditions.
We are constantly monitoring river levels.  We will update this message when the situation changes.

items.eaAreaName: Devon, Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Exe, River Batherm, River Lowman, River Haddeo

items.message:
Flooding is possible from the morning of Monday the 28th June.
The River Exe catchment is forecast to receive heavy rainfall overnight from Sunday into Monday. This is expected to cause the river levels in the area to rise.
Flooding is expected between 3:30am and could potentially continue into early afternoon on Monday. We expect flooding to affect Exebridge, Bolham, Bampton and Tiverton.
Flooding of low lying land in the floodplain and roads close to the river is expected.
River levels are expected to remain higher than normal throughout Monday. Please take care near the areas of concern and monitor your local weather conditions.
We are constantly monitoring river levels and have staff in the area checking for and clearing blockages in this location.  We will update this message when the situation changes.

items.description: Rivers in the Forest of Dean
items.message:
This Flood Alert has been removed.  
River levels are falling, the risk of flooding from localised heavy rainfall has now reduced.  We will continue to monitor the forecast and re-issue this alert if necessary.  
Some further rainfall is forecast over the next 48 hours.  
We continue to monitor the situation.  
Please avoid contact with flood water.

items.eaAreaName: Devon, Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly
items.message:
Flooding is possible from the morning of Monday the 28th June.
The River Exe catchment is forecast to receive heavy rainfall overnight from Sunday into Monday. This is expected to cause the river levels in the area to rise.
Flooding is expected between 7:30am through to 2pm on Monday. We expect flooding to affect  Bickleigh, Up Exe, Rewe, Stoke Canon and Exeter.
Flooding of low lying land in the floodplain and roads close to the river is expected.
River levels are expected to remain higher than normal throughout Monday. Please take care near the areas of concern and monitor your local weather conditions.
We are constantly monitoring river levels and have staff in the area checking for and clearing blockages in this location.  We will update this message when the situation changes.

Property flooding is not currently expected.
River levels have risen on the River Cole and Dorcan Brook as a result of heavy rainfall overnight. Therefore, flooding of roads and farmland has occurred overnight and is expected to continue this morning 28/06/2021, especially in the Lower Stratton area. River levels on the Dorcan Brook also responded to the rainfall but are still within banks. Flooding of properties is not forecast at this point.
Further thunderstorms and outbreaks of rain are forecast this afternoon, overnight and tomorrow. River levels have peaked and started falling, but still pose a flood risk.
We are closely monitoring the situation. 
Please remain safe and aware of your local surroundings and refer to the 'River and Sea levels in England' webpage for current river levels. 
This message will be updated tomorrow, 28/06/2021, or as the situation changes.

items.eaAreaName: Devon, Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Tamar, River Strat, River Neet, River Ottery, River Kensey

items.message:
Flooding is possible overnight tonight Sunday 27th June and into Monday morning. 
Following rainfall today, heavy showers are forecast to continue throughout the remainder of today and overnight. The Flood Alert threshold is likely to be met overnight and into the early hours of the morning.
This may result in flooding to low lying land and roads close to the river.
Further scattered heavy showers are forecast on Monday, with another band of heavier rainfall forecast for Monday evening into Tuesday. We expect river levels to remain high throughout this period.
Take care near the areas of concern and monitor your local weather conditions.  We are monitoring river levels and have staff in the area checking for and clearing blockages. This message will be updated on Monday afternoon or earlier if the situation changes.

River levels have risen at the Castle Farm river gauge overnight as a result of Friday's heavy rainfall and are likely to remain high into this evening.  Consequently, flooding of roads and farmland is expected this morning.  Flooding is affecting low-lying land and roads adjacent to the River Blythe between Cheswick Green and Blyth End.  We are closely monitoring the situation.  Our incident response staff are actively checking river levels and the weather forecast.  
Please avoid using low lying footpaths and bridges near local watercourses and plan driving routes to avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded.  
This message will be updated tomorrow morning, 28/06/2021, or as the situation changes.

This Flood Alert has been removed.  
River levels are falling, the risk of flooding from localised heavy rainfall has now reduced.  We will continue to monitor the forecast and re-issue this alert if necessary.  
Some further rainfall is forecast over the next 48 hours.  
We continue to monitor the situation.  
Please avoid contact with flood water.

items.description: Tidal Thames riverside from Putney Bridge to Teddington Weir
items.eaAreaName: Kent, South London and East Sussex

floodArea.county: Greater London, Hammersmith and Fulham, Hounslow, Richmond upon Thames, Wandsworth

items.message:
River levels are expected to be high as a result of spring tides.

The forecast high tide at Richmond will be 4.61mAOD at 18:15 on 28/06/21 and 4.73mAOD at 07:00 on 29/06/21.

Flooding of low-lying roads and footpaths is expected, which may exist for one to two hours either side of high tide. Flooding of properties is not expected.

We believe there is a possibility of flooding for Putney Embankment (SW15), Chiswick Mall and Strand on the Green (W4), Thames Bank at Mortlake (SW14), Ranelagh Drive (TW1), Friars Lane and Water Lane (TW9), Riverside and The Embankment at Twickenham, and the Towpath below Teddington Lock. 

Astronomical tide levels are falling. The river flow at Teddington Weir is normal for this time of year at 70 cubic metres per second and is rising. We anticipate the flows to remain normal for the next few days.

We are closely monitoring the situation.

This message will be updated by 11:00 on 29/06/21, or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Kennet and its tributaries from Berwick Bassett down to Newbury

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Kennet, River Og, River Aldbourne, Froxfield Stream, River Dun, River Shalbourne

items.message:
Property flooding is not currently expected.
River levels have fallen on the River Kennet but are currently stable and should begin to fall again soon. Therefore, the risk of flooding is reducing. 
Heavy rain and isolated heavy showers are forecast for this afternoon, overnight and Monday. We expect river levels to begin falling again this afternoon 27/06/2021.
We are closely monitoring the situation. Our incident response staff are in the area checking defences. 
Please remain safe and aware of your local surroundings and refer to the 'River and Sea levels in England' webpage for current river levels. 
This message will be updated tomorrow 28/06/2021, or as the situation changes.

Property flooding is not currently expected. River levels have risen on the upper River Loddon as a result of heavy rainfall yesterday afternoon and overnight. Therefore, flooding of low lying roads and farmland is expected this morning, 28/06/21, especially in the Bramley and Sherfield on Loddon Areas. 

Further heavy rainfall showers are possible today and tomorrow. We expect river levels to remain high and sensitive to further forecast rainfall. 
We are closely monitoring the situation. Please refer to the 'River and Sea levels in England' webpage for current river levels, avoid using low lying footpaths near local watercourses, and see the GOV.UK website for a 5 day flood forecast. This message will be updated tomorrow morning, 29/06/21, or earlier if the situation changes

This message has been issued because some minor flooding to low lying land, roads and riverside areas is likely from now and through today, Monday 28 June 2021. River levels are responding to overnight rainfall. We are not currently expecting the situation to escalate, or to issue any further warning messages at this time. The forecast is for some further showers through today. Some of these showers could be heavy later on, although these heavier showers are forecast to be localised and not widespread. Take care on riverside footpaths and don’t put yourself in unnecessary danger. We are monitoring the situation and are not expecting the situation to escalate. We will update this message by 4pm today, Monday 28 June.

This Flood Alert has been removed.  
River levels are falling, the risk of flooding from localised heavy rainfall has now reduced.  We will continue to monitor the forecast and re-issue this alert if necessary.  
Some further rainfall is forecast over the next 48 hours.  
We continue to monitor the situation.  
Please avoid contact with flood water.

We continue to monitor the situation.

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Stour, River Lodden, River Shreen

items.message:
River levels are forecast to rise on the Upper Dorset Stour, Shreen Water due to rainfall.
Flooding is forecast to affect locations near the Upper Dorset Stour, Shreen Water, with low lying land expected to be most affected, particularly around tributaries between Gillingham and Sturminster Newton.
Flooding is possible at tributaries between Gillingham and Sturminster Newton from 06:00 AM on 28/06/2021.
Further rainfall is forecast overnight.
River levels are forecast to rise at the Colesbrook, Gillingham Le Neubourg Way, Hammoon, Lodden Bridge, Milton on Stour  gauges.
We are monitoring rainfall and river levels and are checking rivers for blockages in the area.
Monitor local water levels and weather conditions. Consider putting your flood plan into action. You should avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water.
This message will be updated by 12:00 noon on 28/06/2021, or as the situation changes.

items.eaAreaName: Devon, Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Camel, River Allen, Bodmin Town Leat, River Valency

items.message:
Flooding is possible overnight tonight Sunday 27th June and into Monday morning. 

Following rainfall today, heavy showers are forecast to continue throughout the remainder of today and overnight. Where the heaviest rain occurs, this may lead to Flood Alert thresholds being met in the early hours of the morning.

This may result in flooding to low lying land and roads close to the river.

Further scattered heavy showers are forecast on Monday, with another band of heavier rainfall forecast for Monday evening into Tuesday. We expect river levels to remain high throughout this period.

Take care near the areas of concern and monitor your local weather conditions.  We are monitoring river levels and have staff in the area checking for and clearing blockages. This message will be updated on Monday afternoon or earlier if the situation changes.
